author: Reuters
title: Francia, Alemania, Reino Unido y EEUU condenan el mayor enriquecimiento de uranio en Irán Por Reuters
text:
© Reuters. FOTO DE ARCHIVO: La bandera iraní ondea frente a la sede del Organismo Internacional de Energía Atómica (OIEA) en Viena, Austria, 5 de junio de 2023. REUTERS/Leonhard Foeger/Archivo 28 dic (Reuters) - Francia, Alemania, Reino Unido y Estados Unidos condenaron el aumento de la producción iraní de uranio altamente enriquecido tras un informe del OIEA de principios de semana.
"Instamos a Irán a dar marcha atrás inmediatamente en estos pasos y a desescalar su programa nuclear", dijeron los portavoces de los países en un comunicado conjunto el jueves.
"Seguimos comprometidos con una solución diplomática y reafirmamos nuestra determinación de que Irán nunca desarrolle un arma nuclear", añade el comunicado.
Un informe del Organismo Internacional de Energía Atómica (OIEA) al que tuvo acceso Reuters el martes dijo que Irán ha "aumentado su producción de uranio altamente enriquecido, revirtiendo una reducción previa de la producción desde mediados de 2023"
(Reporte de Baranjot Kaur en Bengaluru; Editado en español por Javier López de Lérida)
Francia, Alemania, Reino Unido y EEUU condenan el mayor enriquecimiento de uranio en Irán

author: Redacción PERÚ21
title: \u0022Este año ha sido increíble\u0022: Pamela Franco sorprende con optimista frase
text:
"Este año ha sido increíble": Pamela Franco sorprende con optimista frase
La pareja de Christian Cueva recibirá el Año Nuevo con su nuevo tema 'Mix ausencia', que habla sobre la decepción amorosa.
[Pamela Franco](https://peru21.pe/noticias/pamela-franco/) terminará el año por todo lo alto. Después de los temas "Dile la verdad" y "Mil amores", la cantante lanzará su nueva canción “Mix ausencia”, que busca imponerse como el tema del verano.
La pareja de Christian Cueva compartió su entusiasmo por esta nueva etapa. “Este año ha sido increíble y qué mejor manera de despedirlo que con una canción llena de sentimiento. Quiero celebrar con todos mis seguidores y disfrutar de cada momento junto a ellos”, expresó emocionada.
Este nuevo tema en voz de Pamela Franco, refleja el profundo dolor emocional y la desesperación que experimenta una persona tras una decepción amorosa. La letra menciona que la persona amada lo traicionó por dinero, lo que acentúa la herida emocional y el sentimiento de haber sido utilizado.
Como se recuerda, este año la artista destaca por varios de sus éxitos musicales que la vienen rompiendo no solo en las redes sociales, sino en los conciertos.
"Esta es una canción para bailarla para el Año Nuevo, para recibirlo así, chapa tu pareja al toque. Que se vaya ese 2024 con todo lo malo y que venga este 2025 con toda la bendición", expresó.
FIESTÓN PARA RECIBIR EL 2025
Pamela recibirá el 2025 a lo grande con una presentación especial en el Palmeras Festival, un evento que reunirá a grandes exponentes de la música tropical y en donde no podrá faltar su nuevo tema "Mix ausencia".
“Será una oportunidad perfecta para empezar el año con alegría y buena música. Los invito a unirse a esta fiesta, a dejar atrás el estrés y a compartir juntos momentos inolvidables”, añadió.
El show se llevará a cabo el miércoles 1 de enero en la cuadra 6 de la avenida Trapiche, en Lima Norte. Pamela Franco compartirá escenario con artistas destacados como Charanga Habanera, Brunella Torpoco, La Caro Band, Barrio Fino, y Alexander Abreu, entre otros.
Las entradas para el evento ya están disponibles en Teleticket. “Quiero que mi música sea un puente para unir corazones y empezar el año con la mejor energía. Los espero a todos”, concluyó la cantante.
Aprovecha la NUEVA EXPERIENCIA, recibe por correo y por Whatsapp nuestro periódico digital enriquecido. [Perú21 ePaper](https://epaper.peru21.pe/).
¡Ahora disponible en Yape! Búscanos en YAPE Promos.

author: Brent Richter
title: NDP nominates nurse practitioner to run in West Vancouver-Capilano
text:
West Vancouver NDP members have nominated longtime activist and nurse practitioner Sara Eftekhar to run for them in West Vancouver-Capilano.
The party confirmed Eftekhar, 34, as their candidate following a nomination meeting on July 7.
Eftekhar came to Canada with her family from Iran when she was eight and spent much of her young life as an advocate, including becoming Canada’s first ever youth delegate to the United Nations. She has been a volunteer for Hollyburn Family Services, where she used her Farsi language skills to help the non-profit reach women in the Persian community.
Professionally, she worked as a Lions Gate Hospital nurse before becoming a nurse practitioner, and has spent much of her spare time advocating free contraception. And as a member of the North Shore Co-ordinating Committee to End Violence Against Women, she helped launch the hospital’s new forensic nursing unit.
Eftekhar said she was inspired to enter the political arena so she could bring change on wider scale.
“As an outsider of the political system, there’s a limit to how much that you can do. And from talking to previous MLAs… I’ve just learned that you can do so much more in terms of making systems change,” she said. “I’m looking forward to being able to bring that advocacy and activism background as well as my empathy and compassion and listening skills into politics."
In the months leading up to the Oct. 19 election, Eftekhar said you can expect to hear her campaigning on housing affordability, working with the North Shore municipalities on transportation solutions and, given her professional background, increasing access to primary care for seniors and families.
Prior to their name change to BC United, the BC Liberals counted West Vancouver-Capilano as one of their safest seats, routinely winning the riding with more than 55 per cent of the popular vote. But voters there have only had two MLAs since 2001, and Eftekhar said the centre-right party takes the riding for granted.
“The demographics are changing and I believe that it’s really time for a fresh voice and a fresh perspective,” she said.
Also nominated in West Vancouver-Capilano is Caroline Elliott, running for BC United. The BC Conservatives and Green Party have not yet named candidates.

author: EIN News
title: Engineer Mother’s Fight for Survival Amidst War: A Plea for Help and Hope - Asian American News Today - EIN Presswire
text: War-stricken family seeks aid for basic necessities and safety. EINPresswire.com / -- This press release tells the story of Baraa, a civil engineer and a mother of three beautiful children: Majd (5 years old), Liya (3 years old), and Kanan (11 months old). Their lives, once filled with safety and joy, took a drastic turn when war struck their home. On October 11, their house was destroyed in a devastating bombardment. Miraculously, they managed to escape, but not without scars. Baraa and her son Majd were injured during their desperate journey through several areas. Now, they find themselves in an unknown place, uncertain if displacement is yet again on the horizon—this time, for the ninth time. Living in extreme cold, they reside in a makeshift tent. The basic necessities for life and childhood are scarce. The youngest, Kanan, needs simple things like milk and diapers, which are currently unavailable. The harsh realities of war are a daily experience. The aim is simple. It is for these children to live safely, away from the trauma they’ve endured. Support can make a difference. Every donation , no matter how small, brings them closer to warmth, safety, and hope. How to Help : Donation: Contributions will directly impact their lives. Even a small amount can provide comfort and sustenance. Spreading the Word: Informing others about the campaign and sharing their story can make a big difference. Advocacy: Raising awareness about the plight of families in similar situations can lead to peace and humanitarian aid. Gratitude is extended to all who stand with them during this difficult time. Together, a brighter future for Majd, Liya, and Kanan can be created. Let’s turn their tears into smiles and their fear into hope. Contact: For more information, please contact… https://gofund.me/628730e5 Braah zohair Braah zohair email us here Visit us on social media: Culture, Society & Lifestyle , Human Rights , International Organizations , Politics , World & Regional EIN Presswire does not exercise editorial control over third-party content provided, uploaded, published, or distributed by users of EIN Presswire. We are a distributor, not a publisher, of 3rd party content. Such content may contain the views, opinions, statements, offers, and other material of the respective users, suppliers, participants, or authors. Submit your press release

author: minutounocom
title: La palabra del capitán de Marruecos tras el escándalo con la Selección Argentina Sub-23
text: La palabra del capitán de Marruecos tras el escándalo con la Selección Argentina Sub-23 Achraf Hakimi, capitán de Marruecos, se expresó tras la polémica victoria 2-1 ante Argentina por los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024. La caída por 2-1 de la Selección Argentina Sub-23 ante Marruecos se llevó todas las miradas del primer día de los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024. El escándalo por el gol anulado a Cristian Medina, [la invasión de hinchas marroquíes a la cancha](https://www.minutouno.com/deportes/seleccion/escandalo-asi-se-retiro-la-cancha-la-argentina-sub-23-los-incidentes-n6037668) y [la reanudación del juego por solo tres minutos más de dos horas después de ser suspendido](https://www.minutouno.com/deportes/marruecos/papelon-los-juegos-olimpicos-se-reanudo-el-partido-anularon-el-gol-medina-y-argentina-perdio-n6037722) fue tan grande que referentes como [Lionel Messi y Rodrigo De Paul, entre otros, se expresaron al respecto a través de las redes sociales](https://www.minutouno.com/deportes/lionel-messi/la-inmediata-reaccion-el-papelon-argentina-vs-marruecos-los-juegos-olimpicos-n6037752). Pero no fueron los únicos, ya que Achraf Hakimi, capitán de Marruecos, fue quien tomó la palabra en el conjunto rival. En un posteo a través de sus redes sociales con fotos suyas y de sus compañeros, el futbolista del PSG se mostró contento con la victoria, pero repudió la invasión de los hinchas. "Empezamos los Juegos Olímpicos con una victoria importante. Lamento la actitud de algunos seguidores durante el partido, que ha empañado la imagen de nuestros fieles fans. Este comportamiento no tiene cabida en el fútbol. Siempre Marruecos", lanzó. "Desde la Asociación del Fútbol Argentino ya elevamos el reclamo a la Comisión Disciplinaria de FIFA para que se tomen las medidas reglamentarias pertinentes y se imponga una sanción a quien o quienes corresponda", informó por su parte Chiqui Tapia, presidente de la AFA. Argentina vs. Marruecos: el escándalo que protagonizó el árbitro La Selección Argentina caía por 2-1 y, justo sobre el final del partido, un gol de Cristian Medina puso las cosas 2-2. Sin embargo, tras el tanto del argentino, cinco hinchas marroquíes invadieron a la cancha, se encendieron bengalas en la tribuna de Marruecos, le tiraron un sinfín de vasos al volante de Boca durante su festejo y un petardo no hirió a un futbolista argentino de milagro. Todo eso, claro, llevó a suspender el partido, del que por más de dos horas no se supo si se reanudaba o no. Luego de todo ese tiempo, [el árbitro sueco Glenn Nyberg decidió que el partido se juegue tres minutos más y, además, anuló vía VAR el tanto de Medina](https://www.minutouno.com/deportes/marruecos/la-decision-que-tomaron-el-arbitro-que-dirigio-el-escandaloso-argentina-n6038326) porque Bruno Amione, partícipe del gol, se encontraba en posición adelantada. Dejá tu comentario Te puede interesar Las Más Leídas

author: Redacción Los Andes
title: Una vecina frustró un robo millonario a una financiera: se llevaban tres mochilas con dólares, euros y reales
text: Alertada por la alarma de un departamento, una vecina llamó al 911 y frustró un [robo](https://www.losandes.com.ar/temas/robos/) millonario a una financiera del microcentro porteño. La banda estaba compuesta por cuatro personas. Los dos hermanos y otros dos jóvenes que llegaron al edificio de Reconquista al 600 con el objetivo de llevarse una importante cantidad de dinero. El lugar estaba marcado, el departamento B del piso 13, a nombre de una empresa. Una vez adentro llenaron tres mochilas con miles de dólares y otras monedas. Según informó Clarín, se llevaron 216.664 dólares, 7.420 euros, 6.322.800 pesos argentinos, 25.000 reales, 890 pesos uruguayos y varios cheques. Todo estaba saliendo de acuerdo al plan original, pero hubo un factor que no tuvieron en cuenta. Una vecina alertó al encargado del edificio sobre el sonido de una alarma activada en el piso 13. Minutos después, agentes de la Comisaría Vecinal 1D de la Policía de la Ciudad llegaron alrededor de las 13.40. El personal de seguridad privada, ya los habían detectado, pero los ladrones escaparon por las escaleras. La Policía revisó piso por piso y encontró a dos de los asaltantes en el quinto piso y a los otros en el octavo. Dos estaban armados y los otros dos llevaban el dinero. Uno de los ladrones estacionó en el bunker de Javier Milei Gustavo Javier Collares (27) fue detenido en el piso octavo. Su hermano menor, Marcos Nahuel Collares (23), en el quinto. Además, estaban Cristian Alejandro Coman (25) y Francisco Nicolás Sosa (25). Todos con domicilio en Dock Sud, partido de Avellaneda y vinculados en redes sociales. Uno de los datos más curiosos del caso fue que Javier Collares usó su propio auto para llegar hasta la escena. Y estacionó en el Hotel Libertador, en avenida Córdoba 690, donde había otras ocho mochilas escondidas. Se trata del hotel donde se hospeda, desde el 23 de octubre, el presidente Javier Milei.

author: @wibw
title: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car
text: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car CINCINNATI ( [WXIX](https://www.fox19.com/2024/06/21/retired-cpd-sergeant-family-rescue-unknown-tri-state-couple-during-florida-vacation/)/Gray News) - A retired Cincinnati police sergeant and his family saved an Ohio couple who just happened to be vacationing in the same area in Florida. The Ramsey family is from Ohio, while the Bell family lives in northern Kentucky. Up until June 11, the two families had no idea they lived so close to one another. Some might call it a coincidence. Others will say it’s luck, but these two families call it a miracle. Dean and Shana Ramsey recall the moment they said they almost drowned while vacationing in Siesta Key, Florida. Several streets flooded that day after the area received more than 11 inches of rain, an abnormal amount, according to Sarasota County officials. “You couldn’t see anything but rain and water,” Dean Ramsey recalled. With several cars stalled on the road, the couple said they tried to pull off on what they thought was land. “The water sucked us right into that lagoon and that was it,” Dean Ramsey explained. Watching in horror from their condo was retired Cincinnati Police Department sergeant Mike Bell, his wife Ginger Bell and their three young kids. The Bell family responded. “We were able to stop, slow things down, and assess and make some decisions on how we were going to move forward,” Mike Bell said. That plan started with Mackenzie Bell giving valuable information to 911. “I remembered they needed to know the address, so that’s the first thing I told her and then I told her a car is in the pond and there was two people in there,” Mike’s and Ginger Bell’s daughter, Mackenzie Bell, said. Meanwhile, the retired sergeant and his wife, who is an emergency medical doctor, took action. “I went over to the edge of the water and realized it wasn’t sinking immediately, so I have a few minutes,” Mike Bell recounted from that moment. “At that time, Ginger exited the front door next to the pond. I look at her and said, ‘We need flotation devices.’” That’s where little Hank Bell came in. “I didn’t want them to die, so I ran as fast as I could,” Hank Bell explained. “I went up the elevator, which is extremely slow, and I knew there were stairs that were faster. So, I ran down the stairs.” Flotation devices in hand, the Bell kids handed them to their parents who were already in the water. “He went into the lady’s side and I went into the man’s side,” Ginger Bell said. “She was able to climb out on her own, but I put the boogie board right in front of her. She got her body on the boogie board and that’s when I started paddling and we kicked over to the side.” Ginger Bell ran into some issues helping Dean Ramsey. “When he was trying to get out, his foot got stuck, so he was on his back with one foot out and one foot stuck in the steering wheel,” Ginger Bell remembered. “I looked at her and I said, ‘I’m stuck, I can’t,’” Dean Ramsey remembered. “At that time, I was like, ‘I’m going down with the car,’ but she’s like, ‘Get out of this car! You got to get out! Kick your leg!’ I started thrashing my leg and my foot popped out.” The rescue took about five minutes. Back on dry land, the Ramsey family saw their rescuers as “guardian angels.” The families say they have plans to reunite in the near future. The Bell family wants to remind residents to always be mindful of their surroundings and assess a situation before getting involved. They said if your car is going in a body of water, roll down the windows or punch them out by hitting the corners. Those tactics could save a life. Copyright 2024 WXIX via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Philipp Wolf, Lukas Mäder
title: US-China AI chip dispute reflects broader tensions
text:
US-China dispute over tiny AI chip highlights king-size geopolitical dilemma The export of American computer chips to China is a multibillion-dollar business from which the U.S. government itself is now profiting. But even as mutual distrust grows, the geopolitical rivals are finding it hard to cut ties.
Philipp Wolf, Lukas Mäder August 14, 2025
6 min
Listen
Share The computer-chip conflict highlights tensions in economic relations between the U.S. and China. Pictured: Port facilities in Shenzhen. Tingshu Wang / Reuters Optimieren Sie Ihre Browsereinstellungen NZZ.ch benötigt JavaScript für wichtige Funktionen. Ihr Browser oder Adblocker verhindert dies momentan.
Bitte passen Sie die Einstellungen an.
For the American computer chip industry, a lot of money is at stake. A vast amount of money, in fact. For chip companies Nvidia and AMD, business in China is so lucrative that they are willing to pay a hefty export tax. The two companies have agreed to pay 15% of their future revenues from their business in China to the U.S. government in order to be allowed to continue selling their chips in that country. President Donald Trump referred to the agreement he negotiated as a «little deal.»
However, there are also security concerns in China regarding these American chips. In late July, the Cyberspace Administration of China stated that it was requesting information from Nvidia about its H20 chip, an artificial intelligence chip designed for the Chinese market with the goal of complying with U.S. export restrictions. The agency noted that there have been reports of security issues with Nvidia chips, citing features that reportedly allow the chips to be geographically located and remotely disabled. There is a great deal of mistrust among Chinese policymakers.
Developments over the past two weeks have highlighted the dilemma facing the U.S. and China. Despite their mutual distrust, the two countries are economically dependent on one another. In the race for technological supremacy, exports of modern American semiconductors to China have become a highly political issue – for both sides.
China needs American chips In the field of artificial intelligence, China is still heavily dependent on American-made Nvidia chips. At the same time, the U.S. has for some time been seeking to slow down its geopolitical rival's technological advances. For this reason, starting in October 2022, the U.S. administration under President Joe Biden increasingly began restricting exports of high-tech chips to China.
But for Nvidia, the Chinese market is too important to ignore. The American company therefore developed the H20 chip specifically for the Chinese market. Experts say it is significantly less powerful than Nvidia's latest models. Under Biden, Chinese buyers were still allowed to import this chip legally.
When Trump started his second term in office in January 2025, he initially allowed the sale of these chips to continue. Then, in April, the White House reversed course, and Trump banned further exports of chips to China – albeit only temporarily, as exports of H20 chips to China have again been permitted since mid-July. Thanks to the 15% cut it will take from Nvidia's sales to China, the U.S. government is now profiting handsomely from this itself.
The fact that the export of H20 chips is permitted again is likely to please the many Chinese companies that have invested in this model. Before the export ban went into effect in the spring, Chinese companies are said to have ordered a quantity of H20 chips worth several billion dollars . Comparable chips produced in China are much less popular.
It is therefore surprising that the Chinese authorities are now suddenly raising safety concerns about the chips. The fear that American products may contain so-called backdoors – that is, hidden access points that could be used for manipulation or espionage – is not new. Documents leaked by American whistleblower Edward Snowden in 2014 revealed that the U.S. National Security Agency had equipped network devices, such as Cisco routers, with backdoors .
In the case of Nvidia chips, the Chinese authorities have spoken of a hidden system that would allow the U.S. to geographically locate a semiconductor and even switch it off remotely. In fact, in May, a Republican senator introduced a bill requiring chips to be equipped with a technical mechanism to verify that they were being exported to the intended country.
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has to keep adapting his China business to a dynamic political situation. Brittany Hosea-Small / Reuters The Chinese concerns are likely to relate to this political proposal. However, rather than the H20 chips, that measure would affect the high-tech chips that the U.S. does not allow to be exported to China. Despite the ban, those chips are still finding their way into China illegally.
The accusation of American backdoors must therefore be seen in part in the broader context of the tech conflict. The U.S. has repeatedly accused China of using its own products for espionage-related purposes – for example, in the case of mobile phone components from Huawei or, as reported by The New York Times, in the case of port cranes. China wants to counter these accusations with its own narrative.
There are companies in China that believe the H20 chip will bring them economic success. At the same time, the Chinese authorities harbor a deep mistrust of Western technology in general. China's government administration will soon be limited to using domestically produced IT solutions , for example.
Moreover, the Chinese government has been promoting domestic chip production for the last 10 years. This sector is facing considerable difficulties . However, it seems plausible that China will increasingly seek to avoid using American chips going forward, at least once comparable domestic alternatives have become available.
Between security policy and trade ambitions In the U.S., concerns about Chinese products have grown significantly in recent years. Proponents of strict export controls on chips ground their arguments in part in national security concerns. Every American chip exported could contribute to the modernization of the Chinese military, they say, or at least promote the technological advancement of the Chinese regime. Thus, they do not want the U.S. to supply China with technologies that are superior to Chinese solutions.
With the ban on the H20 chip in April, it seemed as if Trump was once again tightening the country's export policy. Whether this is actually the case remains unclear following the latest easing of restrictions. Trump probably sees in the chip sector what he sees in everything: an opportunity to make deals.
However, not all observers agree that the delivery of American chips actually helps China. There are also advocates of liberal practices in the United States who argue that every chip that Nvidia sells in China helps the company maintain or even expand its market-dominating position. Nvidia's presence in China is also preventing competitive alternatives from emerging there, they note, adding that this will consolidate U.S. technological superiority.
Seeking a modus vivendi The chip conflict highlights the broader dilemma facing the U.S. and China. For security reasons, it would be advisable for both countries to weaken their economic ties. Yet, from an economic point of view, this is extremely difficult and brings considerable disadvantages.
The back-and-forth over export licenses, security concerns and mutual accusations are the result of the difficulty in decoupling economic relations between the countries. It remains to be seen how Trump will approach this process and whether he will ultimately change the course of U.S. policies toward China. For its part, China also still appears to be seeking a path toward compromise.
In the best-case scenario, the latest developments would lead to a modus vivendi in trade relations between the two countries, which are already political opponents but still economic partners. However, things could also turn out differently, with Beijing or Washington opting for a hard line and seeking to decouple economic relations altogether. That would solve the dilemma – but it would also mean the end of a lucrative business relationship.

Standing outside the American media establishment, the NZZ offers distinctive insights that challenge the polarized narratives often found in U.S. coverage. Our goal is to provide in-depth, nuanced reporting on global affairs, including developments in the United States, Europe, China and beyond. Taking a nonpartisan stance, we approach events with a sober and critical eye. Backed by a trusted network of international correspondents and expert reporters based in Switzerland, we deliver sharp analysis and a deeper understanding of geopolitics and the global economy.
